revisions.rev:
{{Infobox New Zealand suburbs | name = Henderson | image = | caption1 = | city1 = Auckland City | city2 = | ward = Henderson | established = | area = | population = 4,026 | popdate = 2006 | trainstations = [[Henderson Train Station]] | ferryterminals = | airports = | hospitals = | north = [[Lincoln, Auckland|Lincoln]] | northeast = [[Te Atatu South]] | east = [[Glendene, New Zealand|Glendene]] | southeast = [[Sunnyvale, Auckland|Sunnyvale]] | south = [[McLaren Park, New Zealand|McLaren Park]] | southwest = [[Palm Heights]] | west = [[Western Heights, Auckland|Western Heights]] | northwest = [[Henderson North, New Zealand|Henderson North]] | map = NZ-Henderson.png | caption2 = }} '''Henderson''' is a major suburb of [[Auckland]], in the [[North Island]] of [[New Zealand]]. It is located 13 kilometres to the west of Auckland city centre, and two kilometres to the west of the [[Whau River]], a southwestern arm of the [[Waitemata Harbour]].
==Description== The population was 4,026 in the [[New Zealand Census of Population and Dwellings|2006 Census]], an increase of 123 from 2001.<ref>{{NZ Quickstats|3510800|Henderson South}}</ref>
The suburb is in the Waitakere ward, one of the thirteen administrative divisions of Auckland City. It was named after early colonial settler [[Thomas Henderson (New Zealand)|Thomas Henderson]], who started a timber mill in the area in ca. 1847 to process the [[kauri]] trees which were cut from the Henderson Valley, and upstream from the eastern flanks of the [[Waitakere Ranges]].<ref name="Henderson Heritage Trail">{{cite web|title=Henderson Heritage Trail |url=http://www.waitakere.govt.nz/ArtCul/hr/hrtgtril_2.asp |publisher=Waitakere City Council|accessdate=5 January 2011 }}</ref>
Henderson features a large shopping and theatre complex, the Australian-owned [[Westfield WestCity]] shopping centre, with numerous other shops and large-scale stores also in the area. Waitakere Central, the new multi-million dollar home of the [[Waitakere City Council]] sits across the western train line from West City.
[[Henderson Train Station]] has recently been expanded to accommodate a second track and a bus depot is planned nearby. The public transport hub has been dubbed "Baby [[Britomart Transport Centre|Britomart]]".
At the northern end of Henderson, near the Lincoln Road motorway interchange, the ''[[Toroa (ferry)|Toroa]]'', a historical ferry being restored, is a well-known local landmark.
==Education== [[Henderson High School (Auckland)|Henderson High School]] is a secondary (years 9-13) school with a [[Socio-Economic Decile|decile rating]] of 4 and a roll of 932.<ref>{{TKI|45|Henderson High School}}</ref> Henderson Intermediate is an intermediate (years 7-8) school with a [[Socio-Economic Decile|decile rating]] of 3 and a roll of 531.<ref>{{TKI|1307|Henderson Intermediate}}</ref> The high school was founded in 1953<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hhs.school.nz/s_history.html|title=School Information - History|publisher=Henderson High School|accessdate=2009-05-26}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> and the intermediate school was established by 1960.<!-- information from http://www.oldfriends.co.nz/Institution.aspx?id=2355&page=1, which requires a login and is not authoritative -->
There are two Catholic secondary school, [[St Dominic's College, Henderson]] (for girls - opened in 1952, transferred to Henderson in 1967 - decile 6) and [[Liston College]] (for boys - opened in 1974 - decile 5).
Henderson School and Henderson South School are contributing primary (years 1-6) schools with a [[Socio-Economic Decile|decile ratings]] of 3 and 2, and roll of 168<ref>{{TKI|1309|Henderson School}}</ref> and 247,<ref>{{TKI|1310|Henderson South School}}</ref> respectively. Henderson School was founded in 1873<ref>{{cite book|title=Henderson Primary School: 125th Anniversary, 1873â1998|last=Hunt|first=Graeme|publisher=125th Anniversary Organising Committee|year=1978}}</ref> and Henderson South School in 1967.<ref>{{cite book|title=Henderson South School 25th Jubilee, 1967-1992|author=N.Z. Henderson South School (Henderson)|year=1992}}</ref>
Holy Cross School, a Catholic primary school, is a full primary (years 1-8) school with a [[Socio-Economic Decile|decile rating]] of 4 and a roll of 481 .<ref>{{TKI|1316|Holy Cross School}}</ref> It celebrated its 75th jubilee in 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aucklandirish.co.nz/news.php?extend.60.4|title=Holy Cross School 75th Jubilee|publisher=Auckland Irish Society|accessdate=2009-05-26}}</ref> .
== Transport ==
The [[Western Line, Auckland|Western Rail Line]] runs through the suburb, with [[Henderson Train Station]] being just to the west of the town centre.
Both main walk- and cycleways of the [[Project Twin Streams]] go through the suburb.
